de.polygonal.ds.Graph

type
class
implements
Collection<T>
A weighted graph.
See http://lab.polygonal.de/2007/06/13/data-structures-example-the-graph-class/

Constructor

new(?maxSize : Int)

Instance Methods

BFS(?prepass : Bool, ?node : GraphNode<T>, ?process : GraphNode<T> -> Bool -> Dynamic -> Bool, ?userData : Dynamic) : Void

parameters
node The graph node at which the traversal starts. If omitted, a random node is used.
process Alternative to visit() if elements don't implement Visitable.
userData Optional user data that is passed to every visited node.
Performs an iterative breadth-first search (BFS) by calling visit() on every element provided that all elements implement the Visitable interface. If process is specified, element.visit() is ignored and process is used instead. The traversal runs as long as visit() returns true; once visit() returns false (or all elements have been visited) the BFS is stopped immediately. If prepass is set to true, the visit() method is first called with the preflight parameter set to true: element.visit(true):Bool. The return value then determines whether the element is further processed (true) or excluded from the traversal (false).

DFS(?prepass : Bool, ?node : GraphNode<T>, ?process : GraphNode<T> -> Bool -> Dynamic -> Bool, ?userData : Dynamic) : Void

parameters
node The graph node at which the traversal starts. If omitted, a random node is used.
process Alternative to visit() if elements don't implement Visitable.
userData Optional user data that is passed to every visited node.
Performs an iterative depth-first search (DFS) by calling visit() on every element provided that all elements implement the Visitable interface. If process is specified, element.visit() is ignored and process is used instead. The traversal runs as long as visit() returns true; once visit() returns false (or all elements have been visited) the DFS is stopped immediately. If prepass is set to true, the visit() method is first called with the preflight parameter set to true: element.visit(true):Bool. The return value then determines whether the element is further processed (true) or excluded from the traversal (false).

addMutualArc(source : GraphNode<T>, target : GraphNode<T>, cost : Float) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError source is null, target is null or source equals target (if debug flag is set).
Creates a bi-directional arc between the source and the target node, with a weight of cost.

addNode(x : T) : GraphNode<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError size() equals maxSize() (if debug flag is set).
Adds a node to the graph, storing the element x.

addSingleArc(source : GraphNode<T>, target : GraphNode<T>, cost : Float) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError source is null, target is null or source equals target (if debug flag is set).
Creates an uni-directional arc with a weight of cost from source to target.

clear() : Void

Removes all nodes from this graph.

clearMarks() : Void

Clears all marked-flags set during BFS/DFS traversal; needs to be invoked before starting a new traversal.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError copier is null: element is not of type Cloneable (if debug flag is set).
Duplicates this graph.
If assign is true the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference. If assign is false and copier is null, the method assumes that all elements implement the Cloneable interface. In this case element.clone() is used for duplicating an element. Otherwise the method uses the copier function.

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this graph contains the element x.

findNode(x : T) : GraphNode<T>

Returns the node storing the element x or null if the x was not found.

getNodeList() : GraphNode<T>

Returns the doubly linked list storing the graph nodes.

isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this graph is empty.

iterator() : Iterator<T>

Iterates over all elements stored in the nodes of this graph.

maxSize() : Int

The maximum allowed size (#nodes) of the graph. Once the maximum size is reached, adding an element to the graph will fail with an error (if debug flag is set). A value of -1 indicates that the size is unbound. Always returns -1 if debug flag is not set.

removeNode(node : GraphNode<T>) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError node is null, node does not belong to this graph or graph is empty (if debug flag is set).
Removes the specified node from the graph by unlinking it from all arcs.

size() : Int

The total number of graph nodes.

toArray(?output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
The output array or a new array if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output array in a random order. The method creates a new array if output is not specified.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object. Prints out all elements if compiled with the -debug flag.
Example: 
	  var graph = new de.polygonal.ds.Graph<String>();
	  var a = graph.addNode('a');
	  var b = graph.addNode('b');
	  var c = graph.addNode('c');
	  graph.addSingleArc(a, b, 1.0);
	  graph.addSingleArc(b, a, 1.0);
	  graph.addMutualArc(a, c, 1.0);
	  trace(graph); //output:

	  {Graph, size: 3}
	  |<
	    {GraphNode, val: c, connected to: a}
	    {GraphNode, val: b, connected to: a}
	    {GraphNode, val: a, connected to: c,b}
	  >|

toVector(?output : Vector<T>) : Vector<T>

returns
The output array or a new array if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output vector in a random order. The method creates a new vector if output is not specified.
